dict.acceptation: 比…活得长，经历…之后还存在；幸存；
幸免于难；挺过；艰难度过；

sent.orig: In order for the forest to survive, its inhabitants must survive first.
sent.trans: 要想使森林生存，首先必须使它的居民能够生存。

sent.orig: The company has appointed a turn-around specialist as the new CEO and may well survive.
sent.trans: 公司已任命一名扭亏转盈专家担任新的首席执行长并很可能会度过难关。

sent.orig: Humans can survive for quite a while without food but only a few days without water.
sent.trans: 人不吃东西还能存活一段时间，不喝水就只能坚持几天。

sent.orig: I didn't know whether I could survive.
sent.trans: 我不知道我能否幸存下来。

sent.orig: With colorectal cancer, only 10 percent with metastatic disease survive five years.
sent.trans: 对于出现转移的肠癌患者仅有10%能存活五年。
